importantArticles.headline: Carnival Corporation & plc (NYSE/LSE: CCL; NYSE: CUK), the world's largest cruise company, today announced an order for two new ships for the most popular cruise line in Germany, AIDA Cruises, for a new class of mid-sized vessel. The agreement with Italian shipbuilder Fincantieri provides for the design, engineering, and construction of these multi-fuel-capable ships, which will be delivered in the first quarter of fiscal years 2030 and 2032, respectively.

importantArticles.headline: Companies are graded in five categories: customer satisfaction, innovation, social responsibility, employee engagement and development, and financial strength.  Bendable Labs, a private firm, works with Drucker to perform the calculations and interpret them.  Bank of New York Mellon’s score for innovation rose 16.8 points from a year earlier, to 62.4.
importantArticles.title: Biggest Gains in Innovation in the Management Top 250

importantArticles.headline: The travel sector is generally considered one of the most sensitive to macroeconomic conditions.  After all, travel, for both business and pleasure, is typically discretionary spending, meaning it's not a necessity.  Carnival is now down 70% from its all-time high in 2018 before the pandemic, but it's also off 25% from its peak earlier this year, a reflection of those recessionary concerns.
importantArticles.title: 1 Growth Stock Down 70% to Buy Right Now
